title: Heffernan 2012 VV Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sanguine and bitter in dried herb, this is a thick dense wine, explosive on the palate in juicy black cherry and berry. The finish is a tad harsh in tannin.

title: Helioterra 2016 Melon de Bourgogne (Willamette Valley)
description: All of Helioterra's white wines are immaculate, fresh and framed with crisp, clean acids. This brings tightly-focused flavors of lemon and star fruit, with a sprinkling of caraway through the persistent finish.

title: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Val Saint Gregoire Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A rather neutral nose just hints at freshness. The dry palate is light in feel, with lemon and pear flavors. Overall this is light, off-dry and fruity.

title: IG 2015 Petite Sirah (Red Hills Lake County)
description: This is a giant of a wine, from the heady, dried-fruit aromas to the flavors soaked in espresso and blackberry syrup to the thick blanket of tannin that wraps it all up. It is very full bodied, feels warm on the palate and leaves an astringent aftertaste.

title: Johan 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Johan grows biodynamically farmed grapes, and generally employs such techniques as native yeast and minimal intervention. The wines, as is the case here, tend to be quite low in alcohol. This offers precise flavors of wild berry, accented with allspice and a toasty note from aging in 30% new French oak.

title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A touch of ripe, red cherry on the nose becomes fully expressed on the palate where it is met with freshness and a conifer tone. The tannins are fine and have the slightest crunch, while the body is light and translucent. This is fresh-faced, honest and clean.

title: Kerloo 2016 Limited Release Celilo Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Aged in neutral French oak, this offers intriguing, slightly funky aromas of lemon verbena, green-apple skin and mineral that lead to sleek green- and red-apple flavors backed by racy acidity.

title: Keswick Vineyards 2015 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)
description: The nose offers intense aromas of orange peel, dried apricot, marmalade and ginger, which carries to the palate along with fresh brioche. It feels creamy and round, with a supple body lending itself to a long, opulent finish.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A tart but aromatic tone of cranberry hovers on the nose and then continues to fill the palate with its tart, appetizing purity. This is a very light, slender wine that offers ample freshness. Drink soon.

title: La Val 2011 La Val Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily, briny, waxy aromas reflect aging and extended time on lees, both of which this wine has been through. Piercing acidity keeps things in balance, while oxidized flavors of corn and salted peach finish strong and slightly bitter. This unique style of Albariño is not for everyone.

title: Le Bèrne 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and baked plum lead the nose. The chewy palate offers raspberry compote, prune, licorice, grilled sage and oak-driven flavors alongside close-grained tannins that leave a tongue-drying finish. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol.

title: Le Bèrne 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of moist soil, underbrush, leather and a whiff of eucalyptus take shape on this. Taut and racy, the linear palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, powdered sage and a hint of clove set against vibrant acidity. Tight, rather grainy tannins grip the close.

title: Ledger David 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: Grassy and herbaceous, as befits this variety, you'll want to drink this zesty, lively wine while it's at its freshest. Peppery and pungent, it's a good stand-in for an inexpensive Loire Valley Sauv Blanc.

title: Maison Bouey 2015 Château Lestruelle  (Médoc)
description: From a property owned by the Bouey family since 1998, this wine is generous, ripe and offers attractive black-currant fruitiness. A blend led by 70% Merlot, it is soft and rounded, with a core of tannins for a bit of aging. Drink from 2021.

title: Markko 2013 Select Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Ohio)
description: Raspberry and pomegranate rise above aromas of white pepper and herbs. Tart cranberry, cedar and vanilla flavors are supported by chalky tannins and a vibrant vein of acidity, finishing on notes of cedar and raspberry.

title: Peju 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in black cherry and smoky oak, this is a robust, richly ripe red, meaty and brawny in leather and blackberry jam.

title: Philippe-Lorraine 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a value wine, thick in resolved tannin and a density of tart cassis and red and black currant. Dried herb and earthy graphite elements give it varietal character and a brightness against the weight.

title: Quinta de la Rosa 2016 La Rosa Branco White (Douro)
description: This wine is soft, gently textured and ripely fruity. Citrus and apple flavors are lifted by attractive acidity and the wine ready to drink young. The aftertaste has spice and fresh acidity. Drink now.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Quinta do Síbio Ananico White (Douro)
description: Named for a parcel of vines in the Síbio vineyard, this wine is perfumed, with aromatic fruit and a zesty texture. Lychees and spice are an important part of this ripe, rounded wine. Drink now.

title: Scala Dei 2015 Prior Red (Priorat)
description: A saturated, grapy nose with jammy black-fruit aromas is massive but not exact. A blocky, clumsy palate is weighty and a touch stewed. Blackened berry flavors show every bit of this Garnacha-based wine's 15% abv. Notes of fig and chocolate are up front on a heavy finish.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Riesling (Oregon)
description: Correctly labeled medium sweet, this low alcohol, fruit-driven wine shows honeysuckle and apricot flavors principally, with a touch of tea. The sugar is offset with ample acidity, maintaining balance and precision, and keeping it in the ballpark to pair with spicy noodle dishes.

title: Tormaresca 2017 Calafuria Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: Vibrant in aromas of peach, guava and watermelon, these notes carry to a creamy palate that boasts lively acidity to balance. A crushed mineral note offers further levity on the finish.

title: Upsidedown 2016 The Gold Drop Collection Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light in color, this offers faint aromas that give up almost nothing on first pour, except notes of spice. Still young, the palate is more revealing, showing elegant flavors of raspberry and plum. If the aromas open up it could move up a notch.

title: Van Ruiten 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Bold and oaky, this full-bodied wine layers wood smoke and butter aromas over baked pear and almond flavors, while hints of new oak run through it. The wine has a mouth-coating texture and tastes warm and spicy on the finish.

title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2012 Briareo Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This opens with earthy aromas suggesting forest floor, toast, scorched soil and a whiff of game. The palate shows dried black cherry, licorice and powdered sage alongside assertive, grainy tannins that grip the finish.

title: Villa Schinosa 2016 Fiano (Puglia)
description: There's a nice vitality to the nose of this wine, with aromas of lemon and grapefruit rinds alongside ripe tones of pear and apple. The palate shows equalthe same verve in ripe yellow apple flavors struck against a core of tangerine and chalk.

title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2016 Niersteiner Hipping Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: While quiet on the nose, the palate of this juicy, easy drinking spätlese offers loads of ripe tangerine, pineapple and yellow-apple flavors. It's not a complex wine but revitalizing and crisp, with a pleasant hint of astringency lending structure to the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Château Barreyres 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: In the village of Arcins, in the heart of the Haut-Médoc, this estate belongs to the Castel family, one of the largest drinks companies in France. This wine, with its generous tannins and ripe blackberry fruit, is easy, generous and likely to age well and quickly. Its tannic structure is fully integrated into the fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château Carreyre 2015  Margaux
description: This wine from an 11-acre property is soft and ripe, with plenty of ripe berry fruits. Hints of the 18 months in wood are still there although they are not at all obtrusive. It is an easy wine just touched by spice, and will be ready to drink by 2018.

title: Château Castera 2015  Médoc
description: Vineyards in the Press family's 450-acre estate surround one of the Médoc's grand chateaus owned by Bordeaux elite over centuries. The wine from 155 planted acres has been spiced with 12 months in wood, giving a toasty character to the juicy black-currant fruit. It is a structured wine, ripe and with good potential. Drink from 2022.
